intro: Potamogeton natans f. angustifolius, commonly known as narrow-leaved pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in Europe and Asia. It has long, thin, ribbon-like leaves that are typically 1–3 cm wide, arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, green flowers that are often clustered in dense spikes, and it thrives in shallow, slow-moving waters. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. Its presence can indicate good water quality due to its sensitivity to pollution.
